page.title: 18Torridon Village Hall
page.content: The Village Hall was built in 1936 and refurbished in 1973.It is a corrugated iron building with white harling on top.In winter it is used for concerts, leisure activities;country dancing, badminton, table tennis etc.whist drives,dances, bazaars,Christmas party and play-group.It is also used for optician,dentist & chiropodist clinics Community Council, monthly Church and other meetings.The T.V.signal,which is beamed from Ben Shieldaig to the hall, is then relayed to other areas which could not otherwise have satisfactory reception.Being a metal building it conducts the signal from the end at which it receives it to the other end from which it relays it. Accommodation consisits of one large woodlined hall with a small platform at one end,also kitchen,toilets,a small ante room and a store,which was added in 1980.
